Reviews.Title: Does not work on US LTE Bands
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: I would like to give the phone a 5star rating (which I do personally), however the description of the phone in question shows that it works on US LTE bands and it doesn't. So while the phone itself gets a 5 star the seller (FSG) is causing the 3 star rating.Unfortunately it looks as if the description for this phone on the website is a mish-mash of the RM-875 and the RM-877. I discovered the RM differences after having to do research trying to resolve the LTE connection issue.  I purchased the phone based on the description itself.  All the initial research I had done was about the quality of the phone.  I had not come across any review that spoke about the differences between the RM versions. The RM-875 does not work on LTE Band 4 while in the description it says that this particular phone does.The phone itself is awesome. Loved how it looked, loved how it felt, especially loved the quality of the images.  However I am sending it back because I do need to do be able to use some of the functionality that you can only get on a US compatible phone such as mobile hotspot.Again, Love the phone just make sure if you're hoping to use it as an LTE phone in the US, make sure the RM number is 877.

Reviews.Title: Non LTE-41MP Camera Phone
Reviews.Author: Mawiyah
Reviews.Content: As news states, this phone is known for its 41MP camera and grip. It takes pictures beautifully.  The phone is comfortable in your hands and fits very nicely-it feels extremely sturdy.I would say the loud colour promotes a persons character. Only gripe is that it is not LTE capable. But why worry about that when there is a 41MP camera? ^_~As promised, the phone is unlocked and navigating the settings to work with my local network had no difficulties. ~TWO THUMBS UP~

Reviews.Title: Excelñent Phon
Reviews.Author: Eric M.
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, I was so used to Android Os, so I was a little scared changing  to WP but this OS is Faster, more stable, simpler, I'm not an app guy so the few apps available  in WP8 store are not a problem, Call quality is Excellent and so the volume of the speaker. my contacts got synchronized from Google without a problem. and  the Camera! Just amazing! The package included the  camera grip, so i have extra battery for taking photographs and the feel of a camera.Since this is the international Version the phone receives the newest  Updates that Nokia releases without waiting the carrier.

Reviews.Title: best smart phone ever
Reviews.Author: Murat K. Baturay
Reviews.Content: I've used iPhone 3, 4, 4S and finally 5. When it died on me 3 weeks ago, I said enough already! Every iPhone I've had something wrong and Apple geniuses open their mouths with $100 min to fix it. Anyways, I tested Samsung 4S and to be honest it was pretty cool, but a hunch you can say, led me to Lumia. The reason was basically my new Dell with windows 8. I love that win 8 OS. As being a long time Mac guy, I can easily say that windows 8 has the best UX, fast, fluid and 'smart' by far. On mobile basis Lumia is the best smart phone I've ever seen. It's an amazing user experience with great hardware quality. I strongly recommend Lumia and win 8. It takes everything you know about smart phones to a new and amazing level. Believe me you won't be touching iPhone or Android phones ever again. One sentence about the seller, they are pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 1020 amazing, however I didn't receive as advertised
Reviews.Author: K. Latchman
Reviews.Content: Amazon had a warehouse deal for a yellow nokia lumia 1020 rm-875 with a camera grip. Unfortunately all I got was a black unit with the charger and headphones. I was very very disappointed - expressed it to amazon and was able to get a partial refund as a result.The Nokia Lumia 1020 - the device is AMAZING. It's just a welcome change going from iOS to a Windows phone. I have a Windows 8 laptop and just thought to myself it's time for a change. The camera is the most important thing to me when it comes to my phone anyway so I said I'm going for it.I had the easiest time transferring my contacts (with nokia's data transfer, was preinstalled on the phone) from my iphone to nokia (usually the hardest part when switching devices, especially when an iphone is involved!)I'm getting the hang of the phone, but can say I'm extremely happy with my purchase, just extremely disappointed in amazon!

Reviews.Title: The best camera cellphone.... However
Reviews.Author: Another Dude
Reviews.Content: First of all, the phone is well built, and very response with Windows phone 8 OS. Also... It has the best camera in the market. I was amazed with it.However, the the battery is horrible... It dies fast. Also, the cellphone's GPS is by far the worst of all platforms. It takes a while to set directions to a place to another. And On walking mode, all the time it request to calibrate the GPS, making you to move the lumia in the 8 sign. While I was walking, I stopped several time to re-calibrate again.Actually, I returned the Lumia 1020 because it came defective, the infamous light bleeding display...But I tell you this, I totally recommend the 1020, if you want to take pictures! Its badass! I love camera, but I love performance... I got the S5 instead...I hope with windows phone 8.1, the Lumia 1020 may have performance improved...

Reviews.Title: Phone arrived defective
Reviews.Author: Steve Nunez
Reviews.Content: Received phone from independent seller earlier than expected.  I hooked it up to my PC and it came up as a Lumia 909 RM 875 phone and not the Lumia 1020 RM-875 - not sure if that made/makes a difference.After I got the phone charged and put in a new sim card, I tried using the camera.  The focus (on distant objects/scenes) did not work.  I used all of the recommended lenses and settings but still was not able to get it to focus.  Finally I turned off the phone, and when I turned it on again about an hour later, the focus appeared to be working again.  Unfortunately, after 10-15 pix, the focus went blurry again.  I went on line to the Windows Phone site and they recommended a soft and/or hard reset.  I did both, but this did not manage to fix the problem.I am working with the seller now to either replace the phone or refund me my money.  Not a very pleasant experience for the amount paid.

Reviews.Title: Good Dealer, promising phone, but ...
Reviews.Author: Aldenone
Reviews.Content: I understand that it is a basic cell phone with a great camera but there are some disappointments,1. The battery, with heavy use it only gives 8 hours? You literally have to charge during the work day and then at night again, not convenient at all, no modern phone, even with heavy use, should have less than a 14 hour battery life. Perhaps a new accessory, a wireless charging case WITH internal battery and a convenient kick stand which extends battery life by 60% or more?2. The navigation touch buttons should never be lit up for long when watching videos or reading, way too bright and distracting3. The browser has no forward button, start page or home button, very inconvenient4. MOST OF ALL, FREE UP MUCH OF THE FILE SYSTEM RESTRICTIONS, if you download something there is no way to find them or get them off the phone,  (leave that for evil and crazy iPhone), a file manager preferably with network/workgroup capabilities, it is windows after all.5. Being able to create folders would be nice for organization, convenience and speed6. The NAVIGATION needs a few things, firstly to be a bit more accurate, often it shows a destination as in the middle of the road or in a vacant lot next door, but also a quicker was to search favorites especially when looking for a destination, more and quicker ways to select DRIVE TO when viewing a saved location and to tell us if we will arrive at our destination on the LEFT or on the RIGHT or STRAIGHT AHEAD, how else will we know which lane to be in, do you know how inconvenient that can be on a 4 lane highway?7. A built in way to check minutes and messages used based on free numbers, out of package numbers, reduced rate times and overseas calls8. NO EXTERNAL MEMORY, WHAT?  HD video recording (10Gb per hour)  and 41mp pics?  My music collection alone is 16gb.9. BEING ABLE TO SYNCHRONIZE with a PC desktop software and OUTLOOK via USB, wifi OR/AND bluetooth.10. A quick console for WIFI, BT, DATA, PROFILES, RESTART, BATTERY SAVER, FLASHLIGHT etc.11. A "breathing light" option for the sleep state to we know when an alert is waiting.12. A non wifi network dependent way to show play video and images to nearby devices, perhaps Miracast along with the DNLA, and a way to show the phone’s screen as well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera phone, though windows phone is very limited compared to android

Too little apps and too little developers.They could work better on the usability and inteligence of the system too.Lumia 1020 heats pretty easily.The camera grid is very nice to save battery or to save a great pic when the battery is running low, eventhough it makes your phone look like a brick.

I am learning something new everyday and I love it. SO glad I decided to go with Nokia over the Samsung. Totally worth it.
